intro: Solanum stenotomum f. wila-chojllu, commonly known as the Wila-Chojllu nightshade, is a variant of the Solanum stenotomum species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale purple flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
